title: Skin Deep Original Soundtrack
description:
The wonky world of Skin Deep comes to life in this 59 track album. Fictional ads, music for cats, jazz ballads, and more, will put you in the shoes of Nina Pasadena wherever and whenever you listen.

(…We’ve just recieved word that Nina Pasadena does not own a pair of shoes.)
longDescription:
<!--textBlock-->
<!--title-->
# The fever dream soundtrack to the story of Nina Pasadena; a tale of espionage, assassins, spacefaring cats, and friendship.
<!--text-->
Written and produced over the course of Skin Deep’s development, this soundtrack aims to bring the game's fun and heartfelt world to life for the listener. Composer and musician Priscilla Snow has created a wide variety of sounds using both live and synthesized instruments, vocals (human and feline), and a healthy dose of good old experimentation.

Additional credits: M Gewehr provided additional arrangement and co-produced the brass heard on the theme song Nina Pasadena (Skin Deep), the drums on the theme were played by Josie Brechner, and the theme’s vocals were performed by Aricka Lewis. Isaac Schutz and Lysandra Nelson contributed additional vocals for the song Productivity (Presented by MIAOCorp). Josie Brecher’s drumming can also be heard in both the vocal and instrumental versions of Little Lion’s Song. The clarinet for the SFPR Theme was performed by Jack de Quidt. Grendel Snow (aka Captain Palanka) can be heard in on lead vocals in Oceans of Yore, PR4NC3 D@NC3, and in Little Lion’s Song (Club Remix).
